cont.entity_a: Expensive but considered worth the cost.
Helps alleviate wrist pain and increases typing speed.
Some keys like the Esc and F-keys are small, not mechanical, and prone to misclicks. Mixed opinions on key travel distance; some find it increases stress, while others appreciate it.
cont.entity_b: Backlit multimedia keys, but not the whole keyboard. Lacks Internet Explorer shortcuts, limiting functionality outside Media Center.

cont.entity_a: High learning curve due to different key positions, but improves typing speed after adjustment.
Key remapping feature is useful, but the lack of empty mechanical buttons for macros is a downside. Programming keys and USB slots are appreciated, but the keyboard lacks a number pad.
cont.entity_b: Requires an IR receiver not included, limiting compatibility. Works well with Windows 7 Media Center and has a good range.

cont.entity_a: Long-lasting with some users reporting over 10 years of use, but parts are not replaceable after warranty.
Some prefer sturdier frames to reduce typing noise.
cont.entity_b: The keyboard is comfortable and easy to store.
Mouse functionality is poor. Difficult to use track-stick mouse; adjusting cursor speed helps. Mouse requires precise pressure, making it hard to use. The mouse is nearly unusable due to its design.
Keyboard works with Xbox 360 but needs additional setup for PCs.

cont.entity_a: Customer service is responsive and replaces worn parts promptly.
Beneficial for reducing carpal tunnel symptoms, though initial adaptation is required. Beneficial for RSI prevention but does not completely eliminate symptoms without other interventions.
